DOCNAME: CASE OF ABİDİN ŞAHİN  v. TURKEY
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Gaziantep .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant retired from his work at the LOC . On DATE the town council calculated the applicant 's pension benefits at CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL NORP liras and ordered its payment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant applied to the execution office , requesting the payment of his pension benefits , plus interest at the rate of PERCENT . The Municipality objected to the applicant 's interest request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an action before ORG to annul the LOC 's objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court partially upheld the applicant 's request . It ordered the Municipality to pay the applicant 's wages and indemnities , plus interest at the statutory rate running from DATE . It upheld the applicant 's request in respect of severance benefit which had to be paid together with interest at the highest DATE bank deposit rate .
CARDINAL . In the absence of an appeal the judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The execution authority made several unsuccessful attempts to attach the LOC 's property in order to secure the payment of the debt .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent a letter to the President of the Republic , complaining about the GPE 's failure to pay his pension benefits .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forwarded this letter to ORG for an inquiry into the matter .

CARDINAL . NORP In reply , the Mayor of PERSON explained in his letter of DATE that the LOC 's outstanding debts to CARDINAL retired staff exceeded its budget . He maintained that the Municipality had therefore offered to make the payments in instalments . However , the applicant had refused this offer .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to intervene on his behalf in order to facilitate the execution of ORG decision .
CARDINAL . According to the information in the case file , as submitted by the parties , the relevant judgment debt is still outstanding .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW provides :
“ The bodies of executive and legislative power and the authorities must comply with court decisions ; they can not in any circumstances modify court decisions or defer the enforcement thereof . ”
CARDINAL . LAW CARDINAL of LAW Procedure reads :
“ CARDINAL . Decisions and judgments in administrative - law actions concerning a specific amount shall be enforced ... in accordance with the provisions of the ordinary law . ”

CARDINAL . Under LAW ) of LAW ( Law no . DATE ) , ORG property can not be seized . Likewise , LAW ) of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) provides that municipal property that is assigned to a public service can not be seized .
